Name: Pop Music Trivia: Top of the Pops
Description:
Hundreds of brain teasers in 6 categories.  Complete on its own or as a great add on to other trivia games. Score points for each question answered game ends when a player has at least one of each category. 
Categories of questions:-
Miscellaneous
Classic pop
Artist and titles 1980's
Artist and titles 1990's
Lyrics & Albums
Pop pickers

Name: Kakazu Ridge: A WWII Mini-Campaign for the Battle of Okinawa – For A Sergeant's War and other games
Description:
SOUTHERN OKINAWA: DAWN, 9 APRIL, 1945
The American 383rd Infantry Regiment has successfully infiltrated Kakazu Ridge and holds the crest, catching the Japanese completely by surprise.  But the men of the 13th Independent Battalion won’t let go of the ridge without a fight.

In this mini-campaign, command either beleaguered American infantry, under constant attack and cut off from their heavy artillery, or lead Japanese troops in ferocious attacks up the slopes of Kakazu Ridge.

Historically, the American companies were decimated and thrown back, but not without mauling the Japanese battalion that faced them.  How will you fare?

Kakazu Ridge is a 3-scenario mini-campaign portraying small-unit infantry combat during the Battle of Okinawa.  It has been written for A Sergeant’s War, but can easily be adapted to other WWII rules sets.

The campaign includes:

     Historical background, with maps and contemporary pictures
     Campaign special rules
     3 linked scenarios, with overall victory determined by holding terrain, overrunning the enemy, and inflicting casualties
     A painting tutorial for 15mm Japanese infantry


—description from the publisher

Name: Sports Review of the Year: The official BBC quiz game
Description:
A game for 2-4 players
Players or teams place a movement peg next to the die symbol on the playing board and it scoring peg below the BBC logo
Players or teams move their movement pegs round the board on throws of the die and answer the appropriate sporting questions
By correctly answering questions players or teams move there scoring pegs to spell S.P.O.R.T in turn and finally land on the Trophy symbol.
When the trophy question is answered correctly that player of team wins the game.
A great way of finding out over 1,000 fascinating facts on many different sports

—description from the back of the box

Name: Vampire: The Masquerade – CHAPTERS: Banu Haqim Expansion Pack
Description:
1 Double Sided Tile
1 Character Board & Sheet
1 40mm Miniature
30+ Cards & Tokens
2 Playable Scenarios

Name: Vampire: The Masquerade – CHAPTERS: The Ministry Expansion Pack
Description:
1 Double Sided Tile
1 Character Board & Sheet
1 40mm Miniature
30+ Cards & Tokens
2 Playable Scenarios

Name: Vampire: The Masquerade – CHAPTERS: Lasombra Expansion Pack
Description:
1 Double Sided Tile
1 Character Board & Sheet
1 40mm Miniature
30+ Cards & Tokens
2 Playable Scenarios

Name: Word Mania
Description:
A Hidden Word game
The object of the game is to list within the time limit as many correct words as possible.  Words are formed from the assortment of letters arranged in the cube tray.

words are written down against the clock.  from the cube which is randomised for each turn.

Name: Grand Fleets (Third Edition): King & Kaiser – The Great War in the Atlantic, 1914-1915
Description:
King & Kaiser is the first scenario book for the third edition of Grand Fleets. Within these pages, you will find everything you need to fight out the near-run thing that was the Great War at sea.

While great armies slogged through the Flanders mud and clashed over a sun-dried patch of Anatolian rock, the course of human affairs was directed by the men and machines that steamed the oceans of the world. Across the Atlantic, the Mediterranean, and the North Sea, two powerful navies battled for supremacy, a life-and-death struggle that resonated throughout the twentieth century.

King & Kaiser includes half a dozen scenarios from the early years of World War I. 
Take on the role of Spee, Beatty, Hipper, or Admiral Sir John Jellicoe: the only man who could lose the war in an afternoon. 
Also included are 160 individual ship cards from over 50 different classes of the Royal Navy and Kaiserliche Marine, along with every major warship in the service of the Austro-Hungarian navy during the Great War.

Do you have what it takes to keep the German threat bottled up at Kiel, making the seas safe for democracy? 
Or can you break the back of the Grand Fleet and provide for the German Empire her place in the sun?

—description from the publisher

Name: Impondo Zankhomo: The Horns of the Bull – Rules for Fighting the Anglo Zulu War of 1879 With Miniatures
Description:
Impondo Zankhomo, The Horns of the Bull is a set of rules for fighting the Anglo Zulu War of 1879 in miniature.

You will need:

     some six sided dice (D6), 
     a pack of normal playing cards and 
     a few ammunition and shaken counters 
     as well as miniatures and 
     scenery 


to play.

This book contains:

     Comprehensive rules for fighting engagements involving British and Zulu forces.
     Four scenarios with maps and orders of battle; Rorke's Drift, Crossing the Nyzane River, Isandlwana and the disaster at the Intombe.
     A construction guide for building the mission at Rorke's Drift.
     A guide to painting Zulus.
     As well as further articles on scenery making and miniature painting.


—description from the publisher

Name: Mini Muffin Match Up
Description:
Math Activity Set that includes a couple of games to play with the contents.
Gourmet Games you roll the colour and number die to determine how many muffins you take from the tray. The one with the most muffins after they've all been collected wins.
Partner Play you race to empty your row of the muffin tray by rolling both die.
For both games you use tweezers to pick up the muffins.

—user summary

Name: The Natives Are Restless Tonight: A Set of Tabletop Miniatures Rules for Recreating Colonial Sieges
Description:
The Natives Are Restless Tonight containing complete rules for recreating colonial siege games, an all-new pritable action card deck and a comprehensive guide to making a 28mm model of Rorke's Drift.

Although this version of the rules concentrates on the armies and units of the Anglo Zulu War these rules can be used for any similar conflict such as the Boxer Rebellion or the French Foreign Legion in North Africa.

—description from the publisher

Name: Invasion of the Saucer People
Description:
Invasion of the Saucer People is a set of tabletop miniatures rules for a multiplayer game of alien invasion and government interference set in America's heartland.

This pdf contains:

     full rules, 
     a printable action card deck and 
     a template for you to make your own Alien Stowaways cards.


Lavishly illustrated with drawings and photographs.

—description from the publisher

Name: Over the Hills & Far Away: Rules for Skirmishing in the Napoleonic Age
Description:
Over the Hills and Far Away

Skirmish rules in a cinematic vein for fighting encounters in the Napoleonic wars.

Suitable for 2-6 players each controling 6-10 individual characters.

—description from the publisher

Name: Stuff and Nonsense: A Little More Stuff and Nonsense
Description: 12 additional cards for use with Stuff and Nonsense

Name: City of Ruins
Description:
City of Ruins is a solo game playable with ordinary playing cards, together with three dice and a token, usually a pawn.  Black cards represent rooms, which are added one at a time using special "docking" requirements.  Red cards represent either treasures or monsters: even-numbered cards are treasures and odd-numbered cards are monsters.

In addition, rooms, treasures and monsters are classified as either Physical or Psychic.  Clubs and Hearts are Physical, while Spades and Diamonds are Psychic.  Two of the dice are used as point trackers for Physical and Psychic attributes.

To win the game you must explore each room and defeat each monster without running out of either attribute.

Each card has a description given in the Card Guide.  Here are examples to give an idea of the flavor:

"4: Room of Eerie Whistling: The walls are covered in what looks like ancient paper wasp nests. Wind blows out of the holes in keening chords."

"9: Cloaked Man: A human in a black cloak. The cloak bursts apart, for it is actually the wing covers of a huge insect. The head unfolds as two spiky legs, and a glow-eyed face with huge mandibles raises up with a horrible hissing noise."

"8: Grimoire of Abjuration: A text to rebuke evil spirits in the strongest terms possible."

The Rules and Card Guide will be given in the Files section.

—description from publisher

Name: Godtear: Rattlebone, Prophet of the Ascended Past & Hexlings
Description:
"Although savage creatures like orcs barely comprehend fear, that is not to suggest this barbaric people does not understand their own mortality. Such notions are instilled in their culture by the bone shamans, enigmatic and revered figures at the heart of each tribe.

Bone shamans converse with the souls of the dead through ritualistic ceremonies born of fire and blood, their eyes flooded by visions gifted by past warlords and shamans. Their words are sacrosanct omens none dare to ignore, for to earn the ire of a bone shaman is to invite nothing but death.

Rattlebone is a visionary of unlimited potential, her voice carrying prophesies not only of the chieftains of old, but the Ascended themselves. Her supplicants wage war across the Burnt Isle, seeking Godtears to gift to their revered figurehead, each shard increasing her power tenfold. But how long remains before her visions tell her to leave the Burnt Isles and forge her own destiny?"

This set includes Rattlebone, 5 Hexlings, Rattlebone's banner and profile cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Godtear: Grimgut, The Vile & Retchlings
Description:
"A wicked sight enough to trouble the bravest of souls, Grimgut is a lumbering mass of spoilt flesh, truly earning the alias of the Vile. Unlike others who seek to attract a band of followers, Grimgut instead creates the Retchlings, the remains of those unfortunate enough to find their way into his gullet."

This set includes Grimgut, 5 Retchlings, Grimgut's banner and profile cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Godtear: Raith'Marid, The Rising Tsunami & Splashlings
Description:
"A powerful disciple of the element that birthed his sire, Raith’Marid is a tidal wave cascading across the battlefield, crashing against his foes and washing them away. The Rising Tsunami is accompanied by a tide of Splashlings, conjured spirits that serve as focal points for their master’s immense power."

This set includes Raith'Marid, 3 Splashlings, Raith'Marid's banner and profile cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Godtear: Shayle, Keeper of the Oath & Landslide
Description:
"Bound to the elementals from birth, the Keeper of the Oath is a warden of the mortal realm, a foe to any that try to seize the power of the gods for their own. Shayle binds each godtear with runic magic, crafting pwerful sentinels like Landslide from living rock with the power of the gods at their core."

This set includes Shayle, Landslide, Shayle's banner and profile cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Godtear: Sneaky Peet, The Maligned & Sneaky Stabbers
Description:
"Opportunistic, untrustworthy and sly, all goblins are loathes, but special hatred is reserved for the Maligned. Sneaky Peet's rapid rise to the leader of the Sneaky Stabbers has as much to do with the blood of his rivals as it does animal cunning or foretold destiny."

This set includes Sneaky Peet, 3 Sneaky Stabbers, Sneaky Peet's banner and profile cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Godtear: Lorsann, The Autumnal Wind & Mistwood Rangers
Description:
"Once guardian of the Eternal Glade, the Autumnal Wind has led her Mistwood Rangers from that hallowed place in pursuit of the destiny which now calls to her. Few have ever seen Lorsann’s face, for death usually comes long before such an event—or, for those fortunate few, quickly thereafter."

This set includes Lorsann, 3 Mistwood Rangers, Lorsann's banner and profile cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Godtear: Mournblade, The Soulless & Knightshades
Description:
"A fallen champion from a past age, Mournblade's cold heart refused to give up his endless lust for godhood. Heralded by grave wind and dark omens, the Soulless has returned, dead fingers once more beckoning to the world of the living and commanding his Knightshades to enact a deathly curse."

This set includes Mournblade, 3 Knightshades, Mournblade's banner and profile cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Godtear: Halftusk, Warden of the Stonekin Isle & Froglodytes
Description:
"The last of his people to avoid enslavement, the mantle of Warden of the Stonekin Isle has long sat upon Halftusk’s broad shoulders. No simple brute but an anguished soul, his demeanour is kindly towards the strange and primordial Froglodyte that are his burden, and terrible to invaders that seek them harm."

This set includes Halftusk, 3 Froglodytes, Halftusk's banner and profile cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Godtear: Rhodri Ironheart, Thane of the Forsaken Holds & Household Guard
Description:
"Proud, stoic, and resolute, the Thane of the Forsaken Holds stands as a guardian against all who would seek to visit ruin upon the land of his ancestors, or its people. Accompanied by his Household Guard, his iron skin hide turns aside all but the mightiest of blows or most deadly of blades."

This set includes Rhodri, 4 Household Guard, Rhodri's banner and profile cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Godtear: Blackjaw, The Sweeping Flame & Unburnt Reavers
Description:
"Blackjaw surges forward as a brazen destructive force, threatening to destroy all before him in a bright inferno. In the Sweeping Flame’s wake come the Unburnt Reavers, vicious orc followers that can withstand the blistering heat emanating from their leader, each racing headlong like wildfire."

This set includes Blackjaw, 5 Unburnt Reavers, Blackjaw's banner and profile cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Godtear: Rangosh, Scourge of the Broken Plains & Red Bandits
Description:
"The Scourge of the Broken Plains is known far and wide, tales of violence and brutality preceding him. A tyrant characterised by his brutal lash, Rangosh is a terrifying opponent to face. Leading not by heroic example, his only followers are cold-hearted Red Bandits, their loyalty to coin rather than faith."

This set includes Rangosh, 5 Red Bandits, Rangosh's banner and profile cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Qwuzzle
Description:
Start by taking a set of nine Qwuzzle cubes and a grid. Now draw six of the ‘basic’ cards. Each card displays an image which needs to feature in the 3x3 grid that you will build with your cubes. The image can be positioned anywhere within the grid, and on any rotation. Your aim is to build all six images in to your grid at the same time, before the time runs out.

Play against the clock or against an opponent, with two sets of cubes and two grids included.

Ready for the challenge to get harder? Introduce the ‘advanced’ cards to make your task even trickier.

Name: Widget Ridge: The Ghost that Stole Lightning
Description:
Widget Ridge: The Ghost that Stole Lightning, a Story Pack for Widget Ridge, adds new card types to the game.

Characters: allows players to start as a character from Widget Ridge with unique abilities and starting cards.

Locations: These cards are shuffled into the Marketplace deck.  When a Location is revealed, it remains on that space, and a new Marketplace card is placed on top.  The Location card acts in every way like a blank space, except it has an additional effect. If a Location appears on top of another Location (in the same space), discard the oldest Location. Location cards cannot be melted unless a card or effect specifies.

This pack contains 11-cards:
2 x Character Cards (Amelia & Maximilian)
2 x Custom Beloved Widgets
4 x Custom Gadgets
2 x Location Cards
1 x Goal Card

Name: Widget Ridge: The Fire in Which We Learn
Description:
Widget Ridge: The Fire in Which We Learn, a Story Pack for Widget Ridge, adds new card types to the game.

Characters: allows players to start as a character from Widget Ridge with unique abilities and starting cards.

Locations: These cards are shuffled into the Marketplace deck. When a Location is revealed, it remains on that space, and a new Marketplace card is placed on top. The Location card acts in every way like a blank space, except it has an additional effect. If a Location appears on top of another Location (in the same space), discard the oldest Location. Location cards cannot be melted unless a card or effect specifies.

This pack contains 11-cards:
2 x Character Cards (Lady Luna & Alistar)
2 x Custom Beloved Widgets
4 x Custom Gadgets
2 x Location Cards
1 x Goal Card

Name: Widget Ridge: Kickstarter Exclusive Set
Description:
This Kickstarter PROMO card set includes:

1 x Borderless Crowd-Powered augment card
1 x Borderless Signal Booster device card
1 x Borderless with a Kickstarter accessory card

Limited supply set unlocked by Kickstarter backers

Name: Widget Ridge: The Faraday Square Incident
Description:
Widget Ridge: The Faraday Square Incident is a 20-card invention expansion that includes all the unlocked cards from Widget Ridge's original Kickstarter campaign.  Cards can be combined or replace existing cards in the Widget Ridge starter set.

Includes 20 new cards:

1x Static-Powered
1x Gas-Powered
2x Cheaply-Made
2x Gravity-Powered
2x Street Cleaner
2x Shovel Cannon
1x Pastry Oven
1x Treebuchet
1x Engineering Anvil
1x And It Has Pockets!
1x With 5 Different Kinds Of Cheese
1x With A Glitter Cannon
2x On Stilts
2x With A Space For Advertising

Name: Qui mange quoi?
Description:
The game is set on a farm with eight animals on a board (goat, rabbit, goose, pony, donkey, duck, pig and hen) connected by a path and various food tokens (corn, grain, bread, apple...).

The player goal is feed as much animals with a correct food as possible.

Each player has it's own bucket to carry available food tokens. A roulette is used to choose between movement and feeding actions and "money tokens" are used to count fed animals.

This main game is for two or three players. There are also two more sub-games described in the rule book. One sub-game for 2-4 players consist just of describing randomly drawn tokens. A player who correctly named/described more tokens wins. The second sub-game is a solo game variant of the main game with a target to feed all animals / use all food.

—user summary

Name: Tune into ... Nursery rhymes
Description:
With beautiful illustrations and rhymes sung by children, the enjoyable and flexible games in this pack offer ideal opportunities to familiarise children with a range of nursery rhymes and develop aural memory. There are games at a variety of levels that can be played with individuals or small groups.

The players turn over the picture cards when they hear the corresponding nursery rhyme played on the CD. The winner is the first player to turn over all their cards. The various levels uses different ranges of pictures and tracks on the CD.

Name: Crom: Companion
Description:
A companion to CROM, the skirmish game set in the Hyborean Age.

Contains:

     an introductory scenario suitable for solo or group play with an illustrated example of play, 
     a guide to scenario design, suggested tactics for playing a hero and 
     a step-by-step guide to building a fantasy tower to get your scenery off to a great start.


—description from the publisher

Name: The Clemson Tiger Game: Death Valley Football
Description:
Death Valley Football is a football strategy game in which you execute your offense by answering questions about Clemson football; everything from bowl games to record holders to rivalries to interesting facts about players, throughout Clemson's storied history.

In Death Valley Football, the object of the game is to gain yardage and score touchdowns by answering questions. All rules of football apply. Are you ready to play in Death Valley?

—description from the publisher

Name: Tune into ... Initial sounds
Description:
With beautiful illustrations and humorous alphabet tongue twisters, the enjoyable and flexible games in this pack offer ideal opportunities to develop auditory discrimination. There are games at a variety of levels that can be played with individuals or small groups.

The players turn over the picture cards when they hear the corresponding tongue twister played on the CD. The winner is the first player to turn over all their cards. The various levels uses different ranges of pictures and tracks on the CD.

Name: Ampsicora: Campidano Plain 215AC – Scenario for Centuria Miniature Wargaming in the Ancient Period
Description:
Ampsicora supplement for Centuria

There are many events of antiquity that deserve to be explored. One of those is the first great uprising in Sardinia. Not so much for the outcome (the defeat of the Sardinian-Punic, Carthaginian, and Iliese coalition by the Romans led by Titus Manlius Torquatus), but for the fact that this event represented, at the very least, the first sign of recovery by the Romans after Hannibal’s climatic victory at Cannae. By regaining possession of Sardinia, the Romans were better able to control the western Mediterranean, and able to gain access to Sardinian wheat, which was used to feed their growing armies. One similarity between Hannibal and Ampsicora was that after their defeats, their cities of origin—Carthage and Cornus, respectively, were razed by the Romans.

A copy of Centuria is required to use this supplement.

Name: Jackpot Payout
Description:
“The race is on to drain the casino of its last penny. The casino’s slot machines are hot! But you aren’t the only one to realize this. Apply smart decision-making while getting a little help from Lady Luck to make the house go broke! Claim victory over the other gamblers (and the house) by walking away with the most coins!

Jackpot Payout combines the wild swings of fortune of slot machines with player-driven choices of deck-building games. Hit a jackpot by matching symbols on all three cards in play. Cards are worth their value in coins, but each card can only be scored once. The game ends with a final jackpot round where players can chain multiple jackpots together! Can you hit the jackpot and win the payout?”

In Jackpot Payout, each player receives the same starting hands of cards and a play mat. A display area of cards that can be obtained is placed within reach of all players. On a player's turn, the player will draw the top 3 cards from their hand of shuffled cards and place them on the 3 areas of their player mat. The mat represents 3 reels of a slot machine.

If a player gets 3 matching cards, they hit the jackpot! Those cards are placed in the player's score pile. Cards will have coins on them in addition to symbols and special text. As the cards with coins enter the score piles, these cards can no longer be played, but they count towards the player's total score.

Once a player receives 12 coins, the game end is triggered and a final round takes places where players have an opportunity to chain jackpots together!

If a player does not hit a jackpot, they may take a card from the display and that card as well as the rest of the cards in hand are discarded. If you need to draw or reveal a card and your draw deck is empty, you must score a single coin card from your discard pile.

Special cards within the display allow players to break and bend the rules - similar to action cards.

Jackpot Payout is a light and quick, family friendly deck-building card game.

—description from the designer

Name: Napoleon's Battles: Marechal (4th) Edition
Description:
"Napoleon's Battles: Marechal (4th) Edition" is a “grand-tactical” wargame rules book which covers the period of the Revolutionary and Napoleonic wars, from 1792 to 1815.

In these rules, players can assume the role of Army or Corps commanders.

A flexible set of Napoleonic wargame rules that allows:

     the play of tournament battles with a standard championship army that can be played in two hours, 
     or recreate bigger historical Battles like Waterloo, Austerlitz, Talavera, Marengo to enjoy such large scale engagements involving multiple players in each side.

Name: Enterprize
Description:
Enterprize is a free preview of the upcoming second edition of Captaincy.

It is a complete and self-contained miniatures game about frigate encounters in the Revolutionary and Napoleonic wars.

It offers a new, streamlined introduction to the innovative Captaincy system and a carefully researched view of the frigate service at the end of the age of sail.

Wind, fire, fear, and determination are seen in new ways.

—description from the publisher

Name: Narrow Seas: A Scenario Generator and Campaign for Small Actions in the Age of Sail
Description:
Narrow Seas: A Scenario Generator and Campaign for Small Actions in the Age of Sail is a generic version of the scenario generator and campaign rules for Captaincy.

It's a meta-game that supplements whatever Age of Sail rules you currently use.

It depicts small fight-or-flight encounters between patrols, cargo ships, and raiders, using novel terrain generation and scoring rules to make these encounters very different from fleet battles.

—description from the publisher

Name: Chaos Risk
Description:
Risk has been a staple of the board gaming scene since it's original debute in 1957, and alongside Monopoly it's seen more variations and reskins that any other product available. But have you ever wished it were a bit more . . . insane?

Chaos Risk is a free downloadable supplement for Risk, a tactical board game produced by Hasbro. 
As such it requires a standard (sometimes referred to as ‘classic’ or ‘traditional’) copy of the game that features the 42 territories divided into 6 continents.

Chaos Risk is not an officially licensed Risk game, and was developed as a free supplement to an official, boxed version of the game.

It has been produced and distributed digitally by Cascade Studios at no profit under their ‘Print and Play’ range of games as a high-resolution PDF document.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fate of Venterra
Description:
The War Begins... The mystical maelstrom which protected Venterra through the ages has suddenly vanished.  As word spreads nations from around the known world hurry to amass their forces. Legends tell of Venterra’s untold wonders and destructive magic, the likes no mortal has ever seen.
  
Fate of Venterra is a war game set in the fictional land of Venterra. A game of pure strategy, with no dice and combat randomizers, every move you make matters and can decide the outcome of the game. Lead one of 5 different factions, as you build buildings and recruit units on your path to victory. You must conquer the wilderness, build up your army, crush your enemies, and pursue quests to spread your influence and gain power. The end goal is to be the player with the most influence by the end of the game and establish your faction's sovereignty over the land. Blood will be spilled.... this is the fate of Venterra.

—description from the publisher

Name: Calderilla
Description:
Small coins bother in our pockets or purses ...
Here you have a game in which these inconveniences are useful. Think about your strategy to collect coins, but beware for thieves and broken pockets.

Watch your wallet well, take advantage of the bonus cards and ask help the police if necessary. Have fun with Calderilla!

In his/her turn each player can play penny cards, get coin tokens, use a thief card against another player or buy a wallet to protect your money.

The game ends when the pile cards is over or when a player gets the 5 Euro card.

Points are the penny coin cards used. If you have got bonus cards you will increase your score.


A todos nos pesan las monedillas en los bolsillos o carteras...
aquí tenéis un juego en el que estas molestias son útiles. Amasa calderilla dándole al coco, pero cuidado con los ladrones y los bolsillos rotos.Vigila bien tu cartera, aprovecha las cartas de bonus y pide
ayuda a la policía si es necesario.¡Diviértete con Calderilla!

En su turno cada jugador puede jugar cartas de céntimo, conseguir fichas de moneda, usar una carta de ladrón contra otro jugador o comprar una cartera para proteger tu dinero.

El juego termina cuando acabe el montón de cartas de robo o cuando un jugador consigue el billete de 5 euros.

Los puntos son las cartas de monedas de céntimos utilizadas, cuantas más uses mejor y si has conseguido cartas de bonus aumentarás tu puntuación.

Name: Diverse City
Description:
The Queen has challenged two rival leaders to build a city together where all factions can live in peace. Each faction brings unique abilities, and more actions become available to players as the city grows. You'll need to build a diverse set of locations to win and become the new mayor. Can you unite the people and create Diverse City?

Diverse City is a fantasy-themed, worker placement, city building game for 1-2 players. The players are rival leaders competing to build and visit locations. As the city grows, more actions become available, but players must race to claim the diminishing real estate. Specialists can be hired, granting powerful abilities to combo and enhance player actions. Points are awarded for locations, specialists, and the diversity of factions represented. Whoever has the most points wins.

You and your rival take in turns placing workers on the border locations of the city. Where your workers intersect you place additional workers - place them on empty spaces to build new locations there, or on existing locations to perform new and powerful actions. Instead of placing a worker, you can recall all of your workers to perform the action of those spaces, including harvesting resources, building locations for new actions, and hiring specialists to improve productivity.

All cards that you build and hire are worth points. You gain bonus points for sets of different factions, building adjacent to other factions, and increasing the city’s population. As the name suggests, diversity is key to victory and becoming the new mayor.

—description from the publisher

Name: Schneckenslalom
Description:
In Schneckenslalom (Snail Slalom), players try to quickly but carefully navigate their hungry snails through a slalom of bland greens to the food in the center of the table. To push their snail forward and around obstacles, they may use only a small stick and their dexterity. In the end, the most well-fed snail wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Langland Domino
Description:
The Animals from Langland meet again in Langland Domino, a classic game with the Langland twist: no numbers, but cute animals. In the game 2 to 4 players aged 4 an up try to get rid of all their animal tiles first. To do so, they have to continue or complete animals on the table. If they complete an animal, they get to lie another tile immediately. The special corner pieces not only have the ever-growing line of animals stay on the table, but also grant an extra turn. As soon as a player got rid of all tiles or cannot lay out any of their tiles anymore, the game ends and the player with the least tiles left, wins.

As all games in the Langland line of games, Langland Domino takes a classic and makes it accessible fun for kids. An appealing display of long animals, and simple tactical decisions are the highlights of this visit to Langland.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mary Magica
Description:
Standing in front of her wardrobe, Mary Magica tries a new spell — and all of a sudden her clothes are scattered all over the floor. Some pieces seem to be enchanted. Mary will have to find these to bring everything back to normal. In the game, players try to find the magnetic pieces of clothing, shown on a face-up search card, by moving the magnetic Mary figure onto any item. To search more effectively players also have to remember which items turned out to be non-magnetic. Whoever collects the most enchanted (i.e., magnetic) items wins.

Mary Magica is a cutely themed and illustrated, mag(net)ical spin on memory games for kids aged 3 and up.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dice Bomber
Description:
January 27, 1943 - American bombers are in the air for their first daylight bombing raid against the German homeland and the mission is to destroy strategic naval construction facilities at the port of Wilhelmshaven. You and your crew are manning the Bone Rattler, a B-17 Flying Fortress, one of roughly fifty bombers on the raid. Your mission is clear, but won’t be easy. Beware of malfunctions and be on alert for German fighters who will do everything they can to stop you from completing the task at hand. Good luck and Godspeed!

Dice Bomber is a dice rolling game in which two (2) to four (4) players assume the roles of crewmembers aboard the B-17 Flying Fortress. The crewmembers will need to lock in the bombing coordinates, keep the plane free of malfunctions, fend off German fighters and return to safe air space. Do you have what it takes to be an airmen from the Mighty Eighth? You’ll soon find out.

—description from the publisher

Name: Moovz
Description:
Some days, you just want to clear your head, roll some marbles, and play! Grab the Moovz board, pick a card, set up the game, and make the marbles reach their designated end position. You're a wizard. Well done.

On other days, you're in a cheeky mood. You want to keep the marbles rolling in a competitive heated atmosphere. Duel mode is made for that. The rules don't change, but the competition is on.

Name: Bamboozle
Description:
Test your powers of invention and bamboozle the other players by making the most plausible answers to some difficult questions.  Score points for guessing the correct answer and persuading others that your answer is correct.
players take it in turns to roll the die and read out the corresponding question on the card.  Every one except the card holder write an answer to the question and these and the correct answer are given by the card holder.  Other players then vote on the answer they believe to be true.

Name: Coca-Cola: Music Trivia Game
Description:
Trivia game played on a 6x6 grid with players trying to get a line across categories:
70's
80's
groups
soloists
singles
america
coke

Name: Host Your Own: New Year's Eve Games
Description:
Comes with a CD for timing the games for the evening.
games include Trivia race CD track with questions for every one to try to answer
Manic memory game a CD track listing 30 items how many can you list afterwards
Who and where in the world from the given audio who can guess the location of the character
Rock and pop trivia CD track with questions for every one to try to answer
That was the year that was questions for you to guess the year
Audio snap each player owns a "shop" players try to name some thing beginning with a given letter that would be found in the current players shop.

—user summary

Name: Island Siege: Second Edition
Description:
Island Siege is a fast-playing game of fort-building and colonization in the Caribbean Sea. Players build shoreside forts to defend their colonists from attack and to score points. Forts allow you to put colonists in play, which in turn can safely build ships and buildings which provide abilities and points. Attacking allows you to chip away at your opponent's fort while gaining cubes which are used to build forts of your own. Your goal is to score 20 coins or get all of your colonists in play!

The anniversary edition of Island Siege contains:

Components and rules for up to four players! The original two-player game included red and yellow colonists. The Anniversary Edition also includes green and blue colonists as well as additional coins, cubes and other components necessary for four players.

The Ramparts and Coquina expansions from the first edition are now included with the base game.

Deluxe two-layer player imperial boards. The new imperial boards includes an island with a quarry to store accumulated stones and a port to dock your ship. The boards will be printed on a thick cardboard. Indentations keep pieces from shifting.

Two sets of Kickstarter-exclusive metal Campaign Coins (26 total)! These metal coins will only be part of the Kickstarter experience. The retail version of the game will include cardboard punch board coins.

Name: Butchers' Bourse
Description:
Butchers' Bourse is an unlimited bidding game designed primarily to be played in the live action roleplaying world of Empire by Profound Decisions. No knowledge of LARP or Empire is required to play or enjoy the game.

Players represent fabulously wealthy members of the Bloody Butchers Guild of Temeschwar who are seeking to acquire the most prestigious artifacts associated with the Butchers Guild.  Players make sealed bids for Artifact Cards which are revealed in turn, each with a Prestige value ranging from 1-9. Three Banker Cards (featuring Lorenzo La Volpe von Temeschwar, The Master of The Butchers Bank, who was the in-character designer of the game) are shuffled into the deck of Artifact Cards; the game ends when the third Banker Card is revealed.  There is no limit to the amount that players can bid, although whoever has spent the most at the end of the game loses.  The winner is whoever of the remaining players has the most Prestige from the artifacts they have bought.

The unlimited bidding mechanic was inspired by that used in Q.E. and Tony's Treasures.

The game is presented in a hand-crafted wooden box which matches those of other games by The Guild of Good Games in the LARP world of Empire.

—description from the designer

Name: 人生ゲーム MOVE ! (Jinsei Game Move!)
Beer & Pretzels: The Napoleonic Wars
Description:
Beer & Pretzels: The Napoleonic Wars

This rules set is designed for battalion-level Napoleonic war gaming engagements.

Many 15mm wargames are extremely cumbersome to learn, need a lot of paperwork and require a long time to play. 
These rules are intended to provide a fast, fun game for both veterans and novice wargamers alike. 
Obviously, house rules can be added for additional complexity – but this way you can build your own complexity as you go.

The game itself was designed by Napoleonic historian Robert Epstein.

—description from the publisher

Name: Battle Fortress
Description:
Battle Fortress is a tabletop war-game with two big differences:

     NO DICE; Battle Fortress uses a Diceless mechanic;
     RTS style gaming; You train/build the units you want to use in the battle.


The game was originally designed with younger players in mind, but we soon found experienced players enjoyed Battle Fortress just as much as any other wargame.

Battle Fortress can be played using any scale, post WW1 models.

Battle Fortress is a game that can be played anywhere, from the dining table to tournament size war gaming tables.

Now with dedicated rules for infantry, vehicles and super weapons for forces from WWII, and Science Fiction, no two games are ever alike.

—description from the publisher

Name: Gnomopolis: Magic!
Description:
Magic was always a useful tool in gnome creations but used sporadically. Now with the exodus to a new place, some magic focused guilds have to reveal themselves and take part in Gnompolis construction!
 Gnomopolis: Magic! is the first expansion to the fast gnome building game Gnomopolis and bring Witches and Mages as new professions. While Witches focus on summon Faeries to help the work on the buildings, the Mages add more interaction among players spreading disguised gremlins on another's districts.

Components:

     Pink Witches Gnomeeples
     Purple Mages Gnomeeples 
     Faeries Tokens
     Black Gremlins (that looks like Gnomeeples!)
     New Building Cards
     New Advisor Cards
     Automa Cards for solo play 
     Rulebook


—description from the publisher

Name: Let's Play All Units Engage: Basic Infantry Operations
Description:
Here is your free introduction to All Units Engage!

All Units Engage is a set of simple rules for skirmish games for two or more players. Play can be based around a handful of minis or include multiple squads. 
The game plays equally well with 15mm or 28mm miniatures.

All Units Engage is a solid “old school” game with a modern perspective. It is a game that flows very well from turn-to-turn and player to player. 
Games are intended to be short, with an emphasis on achieving objectives inside of a brief span of turns.

All Units Engage is a toolkit that invites you to play with the minis and models you already own. 
The focus is on sci-fi, near-future and post-apocalyptic gaming, but the mechanics are flexible enough to support a wider variety of settings such as Cold War and even WWII.

All Units Engages uses ten-sided dice. 
No templates are required and only a few basic markers are needed to track pins and reserve actions.

All Units Engage is casual, but complete. This introduction is only a taste of what AUE has to offer.

—description from the publisher

Name: Oscar Sierra Charlie OSC: Part 1 Skirmish
Description:
OSC | Oscar Sierra Charlie

Welcome to a game that has been through over 20 years of evolution, and has been refined over the last 2 years.  The outcome is a more player friendly product. Blood sweat and tears have gone into the making of it and its’ expansions, and on the battle field your forces will fight blood sweat and tears in grasping a victory.

OSC is not just a modern war game, this is a system for you (the player) to have fun with.

Part one is to get you into action on a skirmish level and learn the nuts and bolts of the basic game.

OSC is designed for friendly rather than competitive play.

With OSC you can experience some fun games with, what feels like realistic forces, using the points to balance out the numbers.

If players wish to form killer forces to win games, then they have missed the main point of this game. The challenge in this game is making the right choices on what actions you take, in what order and how you do them.

OSC is a game of cunning tactics, for those still wanting to create a competitive scene.

Oscar Sierra Charlie puts you straight in the front line of gripping battles. 
This is combat at the cutting edge; individual and squad-level action, desperate missions to capture key objectives, with victory going to best tactical mind.

OSC’s mechanics are deliberately streamlined for fast-paced tactical play. 
Straightforward stat lines are augmented by a plethora of skills, options and tactics. 
At its heart a player-driven rules system, no two games of OSC will be the same. Your troops will stand and fight at your command – their fate and that of the mission is wholly in your hands!

The game world of Oscar Sierra Charlie is one of gritty modern warfare at its core. But it is also far more.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sector Commander: World War II – Rule Book
Description:
Sector Commander is a turn based WW2 board game based at Divisional level.

Steeped in historic units and equipment this game brings together elements from LCGs, board games and table top war games to create a realistic battle environment that will test your strategic prowess.

This is the main rule book for Sector Commander WW2 board game. 
It takes you through all the basic and advanced rules for picking up and playing the game. In full colour with hundreds of diagrams and examples to walk you through the various stages of the game so you can learn it easily and quickly.

—description from the publisher

Name: klang²
Description: Explore music, sound and language in a dynamic way.  Your smartphone and our twenty klang squares enable you to play hundreds of different games. Develop your hearing and listening skills and deepen your general knowledge with klang². Play alone, or with friends and family!

Name: Bye Bye Mr. Fox!
Description:
Bye Bye Mr. Fox!â€‹ is a co-operative game that teaches young players about teamwork and strategy. Work together to help the hens keep their eggs safe from the cunning Mr. Fox! Spin the spinner to see what will move this turn: an egg, a chicken, or Mr. Fox? Move three eggs into each hen's house to win!

—description from the publisher

Name: A Foreign Field
Description:
A Foreign Field

A skirmish battle in the mud and blood of World War 1.

Imagine a small section of the front, with nothing but the lowest ranks involved on both sides, attacking the enemy at range and hand-to-hand, once the Hell that is No-Man's-Land has been crossed. 
There is no mercy to be had or given and the only way is forward, whatever you're walking into.

A print and play game with all you need (except dice and pencils) in pdf format.

—description from the publisher

Name: Micro Ancients: Expansion I – Chariot Era & Far East
Description:
Micro Warfare Series: Micro Ancient Expansion I - Chariot Era & Far East

An expansion to the popular Micro Ancient game, this title introduces three additional beligerants to enhance play: 

     Assyrian, 
     Chinese and 
     Egyptian.  


The section for each army includes counters for use in the game; applicable rule amendments as well as some brief information about the country at the time (source: Wikipedia)

PLEASE NOTE: You must have a copy of Micro Warfare: Micro Ancients to make use of this title.

The Micro Warfare series was originally published by Tabletop Games in the 1970s with this title being published in 1976.  Each game in the series aims to recreate the feel of tabletop wargaming with large numbers of miniatures but using printed counters and terrain so that games can be played in a small space and are very cost-effective.

In these Hurlbat Publishing editions we have kept the rules and most of the illustrations unchanged but have modernised the layout and counter designs to refresh the game.

—description from the publisher
Families: History: Warring States Period of China

Name: Shouting the Battle Cry of Freedom
Description:
Shouting the Battle Cry of Freedom is a novel historical miniature rules system for simu­lating the violent clash of armies in the American Civil War.

Designed for large-scale battles and with an emphasis on strategic planning, Shouting the Battle Cry of Freedom is a Corps and Division level simulation intended to be played by 2 - 10 players.

Players maneuver brigades and batteries, alternating movement and combat in turns that represent 30 minutes of real time.

The table scale is 18” to a mile or about 100 yards per inch.

Features:

     Extensive fog of war allows you to deceive the enemy as to your actual strength....
     Grand tactical charges with up to an entire corps....
     Division commanders seize the initiative, interrupting their opponent’s moves....
     Tactical firefights in addition to fire, charge and melee....
     Unique rules for extra tactical movement, passthrough and disorder....
     Unknown effect of battlefield terrain until units actually move into it....
     Reconnaissance in force by cavalry gives it a valuable role....


—description from the publisher

Name: Clash of Galleys: Large Fleet Battles in the Ancient World
Description:
Clash of Galleys!

 
Fleets crash together in this simulation of large ancient naval battles. 
Maneuver your squadrons in tight formations to:

     Hurl Greek fire at your opponents!
     Blast them with archers and ballistas!
     Ram and rake them!
     Grapple and board to capture them!


Clash of Galleys is a set of miniature naval rules for the era of oared warships, covering roughly 500 BC to 400 AD.

The rules are written to be played with 1:1200 scale miniatures on a one and one half inch hex grid. (But components that allow Clash of Galleys to be played as a board game are provided in an Appendix.)

The rules are intended for large battles of up to 50 or more ships on a side. 
Ships are organized into squadrons of 5 - 8 ships each. 
Each player normally plays one or two squadrons although experienced players could play more squadrons.

Several scenarios are included with the rules.

—description from the publisher

Name: Aerial Battles 1915-1918: Air Wargame Rules for the First World War
Description:
Aerial Battles 1915-1918

WARGAMES RULES FOR AIR COMBAT IN THE FIRST WORLD WAR

Recommended scales: 1/144 TO 1/300; 1/72 OR 1/600 possible
Complexity: 4/10

A SET OF QUICK REFERENCE SHEETS IS AVAILABLE THROUGH THE PUBLISHER'S WEBSITE

These rules are intended to allow two or more Players to have a fast and simple game representing tactical air combat during the Great War in the period from 1915 to 1918; at this time air combat was in its infancy.

Model aircraft of any scale from 1/600th to 1/72nd, can be used. If necessary you could also use card counters.

Minimal bookkeeping is required because Markers or Tokens are used to indicate the status of aircraft during the game. Furthermore you do not need to use a hex mat.

The capabilities of aircraft within the game have been calculated, taking a common aircraft type of average performance as the base line, in this case the Albatros D.III. All other aircraft capabilities relate to how they compare with this aircraft. It is possible that the performance of this or that aircraft might not match your expectations based on anecdotal evidence. We make no apology for this as we are not trying to create a simulation. The resulting data has been kept to a simple format, which enables a Player to control several aircraft during a game, and the overall gaming experience will be improved if multiple Players attempt to “co-operate” on each side.

The abilities of pilots and crew are represented by having Skill Factors. These determine how well they fly their aircraft, their chances of hitting the target when shooting, and avoiding serious damage if their own aircraft is hit. Pilot skill is vitally important in air combat, and Players will need to learn where to position their best pilots, as well as to protect their novice aviators . In the case of aircraft with several crew members, Skill is determined for the crew as a whole. You do not need to keep track of individual crew.

To carry out any action other than level flight requires the expenditure of one or more Orders, which may also require a successful Skill Test. Orders are generated each turn and better leaders generally mean more Orders. 
While air combat is probably what most players will want play, there are also rules for Ground Attack, Bombing, Photo Reconnaissance and Balloon Busting.

Altitude represented during the game assumes that the main combat is taking place in roughly the same area of the sky, and it is possible to climb or dive to gain an advantage, or try to escape.

Players alternate the activation of their aircraft. Optional Tactical Cards can be used during the game to provide additional detail.

Data is provided for most aircraft that were in action during the First World War.

—description from the publisher

Name: Naval Warfare: Battleships to Dreadnoughts – Squadron & Fleet Action 1895 to 1920
Description:
Naval Warfare: Battleships to Dreadnoughts - Squadron & Fleet Action 1895 to 1920

Naval Wargaming rules for the period around 1895 through to 1920 covering the Pre-Dreadnought and Dreadnought eras.  
The rules are illustrated throughout with examples of play to aid learning.

Included are: 

     The rules (57 pages including ship data) 
     two sheets of game record counters - to aid game play. 
     Three 'Quick Reference Sheets' for eras 1895-1908, 1909 - 1914, and 1914 +
     An Excel file on which you can deploy data for your owned ships to make information counters to place by them
     Word files giving alternative formats for recording your ship data on a single table or individual 'card sized' tables that can be placed in plastic card sleeves.


Gunfire is in factors: Ships have four states of damage/ deterioration and Critical hits.

Simple command and control rules allow for the poor communications that existed in this era.

Data is included for ships for the period for:

     German, 
     Great Britain, 
     Italy,
     France,
     Japan,
     Russia, and
     the USA.


—description from the publisher

Name: Naval Warfare: Age of Missiles
Description:
Naval Warfare: Age of Missiles

A game of modern naval warfare.

The set includes all you need to play including:

     an illustrated rulebook, 
     Counter sheets of ships, missiles, aircraft, Helicopters, and 
     record counters and 
     data cards. 


In addition there is a Spreadsheet to aid the design of your own ships.

The game can be played with models or using the counters provided.

The rules cover:

     Detection,
     missile,
     gunnery,
     torpedoes, and
     defensive fire,
     Electronic warfare,
     helicopters, and
     airstrikes


using a simple d6 system, with symbols for each weapon system.

A single A4 full colour starter sheet of counters provides all that you need to get you started.  Other counter sheets provide a range of NATO and Soviet vessels from the 1980s-90s, and all of the record counters needed to play.

—description from the publisher

Name: Devil's Pact
Description:
Who will succumb to the temptation of the Devil’s Pact?
Try to guess it to win the most points!
Devil’s Pact is a party game with simple rules.
Play hilarious and devilishly crazy games!

A game is played in several consecutive rounds divided into two phases:

The Choice
Read the Pact proposed by the Devil and choose if you accept it...

The Judgement
Earn points by guessing who succumbed to the temptation of the Pact!
The player with the most Victory points wins the game!

Name: Four Word Thinkers
Description:
Four Word Thinkers is a simple strategy game of grabbing letters and making secret words - four-letter words to be exact. This spelling game is good for both adults and children five and up.

Play in rounds, each round comprises four "grabs", where players strategically grab a single letter tile. At the end of exactly four rounds, players reveal the word(s) they made.

—description from the designer

Name: Grendha: Origins
Description:
Grendha: Origins Expansion is the prequel of Grendha: Search for Lost Triumphs. The Origins is a wondrous story of Arnorus's fight between vicious predators of Meru and with his confederates Mirgoth, Kondu, and Genu. Grendha: Origins gives a sneak-peek into both Arnorus and Meru's past. This addon is a standalone game and an entirely co-op/solo gameplay for 1-4 players.
The game starts with the exploration of arnoru with his allies to dominate the planet Meru. Four heroes combine their strength to destroy the creatures on the planet. The territories have a strange connection with one another, to capture an area, the four heroes should explore and find the territories which are interconnected. The dangerous creatures have many odd powers that can only be defeated by great strategy. The primary power source of each dangerous monsters lies in different territories. The clue for destroying each creature lies within the hands of many wizards and witches. You have to draw each event card in the time of gameplay to see the clues hidden.

Attacking a territory and conquering it doesn't mean the dangerous monsters are fully annihilated. They can always come back, so spend your energy wisely before you exhaust. The provinces on the planet have many mysterious behaviours. By using the combination of technology, magic, weapons, and armies, you should dominate the planet.

Gameplay overview:
The four warriors start from their home base. An event card is used to see the current situation of the planet. The event cards will tell how crucial it is to make a journey to any territories. For example, the event of the day states that now there is heavy rainfall, which causes you to exhaust your energy two times more than your usual travel. The event card will also indicate the connection of the territory with another territory. There will be certain symbols for showing the links of territories.

Green skull symbol: shows a connection with one territory.
Orange Skull Symbol: Shows a connection with two territories.
Red Skull symbol: shows a connection with three territories.

To destroy a monster in a territory A, the players should place their diplomacy card or resistance card(depends on the type of monster you are dealing with) in the linked territory to diffuse their mysterious power. For example, if Arnoru have to destroy a monster in the territory 'A,' which is of green skull symbol, the other warrior should place his diplomacy card or resistance Card in the other territory 'C.' If its done, Arnoru can give a perfect strike to the monster, and the beast will destroy.
If there is only one player, The player should deploy his Resistance or diplomacy card in multiple territories and should target the regions he/she should attack later.
Thus you should capture the celestial city and make the planet Meru a real heaven.

—description from the designer

Name: FourSight Word Game
Description:
Four Sight is a fast-paced literacy/spelling game of assembling four-letter words from an everchanging assortment of tiles comprised of three-letter words and single letter tiles. Convert a three-letter word into a four-letter word by adding single letter.

—description from the designer

Name: Scrolls of a Northern City
Description:
1935, Taipei City - a wondrous place that is as beautiful as a dream. Even in a dream, it sparkles and glimmers like no others. In the corner of this dream-like city stood a small coffee shop named Bai-Hua-Tang (translated as "A Hall of a Hundred Paintings"). One day, the owner of the shop disappeared without a trace. As the loyal customers of the shop, you must search every spot in Taipei City for clues and bring the owner back for the worried maids. With your brilliant detective skills, can you find the whereabouts of the wandering owner?

In Scrolls of a Northern City, players travel around the city to reveal Clue Cards or ask for the help from the maids or friendly strangers. Some Mystical Spirits in the city will also assist your investigation. Players must race to be the first to correctly guess the numbers on all 3 set-aside Clue Cards to win the game!

Solitaire rules are also available in the game. At the beginning of the game, setting up a mosaic card pyramid pile formed by all Yellow cards faceup with Red and Purple cards facedown. Only topmost Red and Purple cards are revealed. You play the role of the owner of the shop to move around the city according to Yellow card numbers, and then discard the revealed Red and Purple cards corresponding to the city spots. Challenge yourself to reveal the hidden Clue Cards one after the other in a way that can lead you to as far to the top of the pyramid as possible so that you can find out the numbers of the 2 set-aside Clue Cards!

—description from the publisher

Name: Maztec
Description:
"That night, the earth shook. The ruins of an unknown civilization appeared but the earth's crust continued to tear apart, causing natural disasters all over the planet. Strange seismic impulses seemed to come from a temple within these unexplored ruins."

Equipment
Maztec comes with 28 "game turn" pieces, 38 “gem” pieces and 4 "temple" pieces: 
The four "temple” pieces represent 4 parts of the entrance to the temple. 
The "gem" pieces are of two different colors. The front shows a red or green gem with 3 or 4 symbols. The back shows a gray gem and two continuous pattern lines.  
Each "game turn" piece is numbered from 1 to 28 on the back. The front reveals 1 symbol on the decor background of the temple.

Overview and purpose of the game
Welcome Adventurers! As an expert archaeologist of ancient civilizations, you have been commissioned by governments around the world to solve the temple enigma of this strange civilization.  
After a trying journey, you approach these ruins. A camp has been set up. A strange temple with an entrance marked by two red crystals invites you to enter. Carefully, you enter this temple and feel terrible tremors around you. But you're brave and courageous, and you decide to continue as planned. 
As you explore the place, you discover new symbols. You also gather strange green and red gems surrounded by these symbols. These symbols appear to be clues that allow these stones to be placed in the right locations within this temple, by uniting them. After placing back a crystal, the tremors seem to be less important.  
But the earth is shaking again. That’s right. These crystals must be placed back as quickly as possible within the temple in order to permanently stop the seismic waves coming from this temple!
You'll investigate why this is all happening once the challenge is faced, the problem solved.
Only the  sharpest minds can solve the enigma behind these stones. It is now your turn... But time is running out... And if you can solve the enigma of thsi temple, you can finally declaim: MAZTEC!

Elements of the game
“Game turn” pieces: On the back, the number of the turn of play, and on the front, an element of the temple with a mysterious symbol. 
Temple:  the starting point for exploration. This temple is to be assembled at the beginning of the game, already shows you 2 symbols. It is made of 4 pieces.
“Gem” pieces: On the back is a gray gem. Beneath this gem are drawn 2 lines of patterns. On the front is a red or green gem framed by 3 or 4 symbols on the front. These symbols allow you to form combinations by juxtaposing them. But the combination is only successful if confirmed by the perfect combination of patterns on the back of these pieces. The "gem" pieces also have a small "spiral" symbol (a sort of deception maker) located at the top left of each piece allowing you to always put them in the right way.

Setting up
It is necessary to assemble the entrance to the 4-room temple in the first place. You then have to form 3 stacks of parts: A stack of "game turn" parts, sorted from 1 to 28. Number 1 is visible at the top of the stack. And 2 stacks of "gem" pieces must be formed: a stack per gem color, gray gem on a visible blue background. At the beginning of the game, you have to reveal 2 gems below each "gem" stack.

Each player also picks 2 "gem" pieces in the stacks: 1 red gem and 1 green gem per player that he places with the front visible before him. 
Solo mode: The one player 2 red gems and 2 green gems that he places in front of him.

Course of the game
The last player player to feel an earthquake begins.
Game turn: 
The first player will pick a "game turn" piece and add it to the temple. It bears the number "1" on it. This begins the exploration and reveals a new symbol. At the beginning of each round, each player will pick a "game turn" piece. 
Possible moves during a player's turn:  
- select 1 gem piece from the 4 visible ones and draw one of the same color to replace it. If there are no more gems to draw, replenish the pickaxes with discarded gems if there are any. 
- discard the 2 pieces of the pile of green or red gems and replace them with 2 others, then select 1 of the 2. 
    With the selected gem, you can:  
    - place it on the temple by combining it, 
- add it to a gem or to a combination of gems from an opponent (except in a solo   game)
    - add it to one of its gems to create a combination. 
If no placement is possible, the player places the piece in front of him. 
If a placement is successful, the player may try again to place or combine the pieces in his possession as long as his placement attempts succeed, at an opponent’s (except in a solo game) or on his/her pieces. 
Last possible move: the player can try to place a combination of his/her gems on the temple. It is then the next player’s turn (or the next turn in a solo game).

Bonus move:
At any time, the player can secretly (without revealing it to other players) return his/her gems to observe lines that can help him assemble the pieces.

End of the game and goal

”If not all of the gems are placed in the temple before 28 turns... The end is near.”
Competitive mode: If all the gems have been placed, it is the first player who no longer has any gem to place who wins the game. 
Collaborative mode: If all the gems have been placed, your team wins the game.
Solo mode: If all the gems have been placed before 28 turns, you win the game.

If all the gems have not been placed, after 28 turns, the first player who no longer has any gems, or any more combination of gems in front of him, or who has the least, wins the game. 
Must-know: a combination of gem not assembled in the temple counts as a single gem. 
However, humanity will only be saved if all gems are correctly placed before the 28 turns.

Name: Black Stories Junior: Fußball Stories
Description:
The successful mystery series "Black Stories" is also available in the "scary-free" version - for families with children from 8 years old. Instead of dark and scary it gets colorful and funny at the "Black Stories Junior".

Black Stories Junior: Fußball Stories are riddles for young soccer fans. The players try to reconstruct the stories by asking, guessing and fiddling about.

Name: Black Stories Junior: Adventure Stories
Description:
The successful mystery series "Black Stories" is also available in the "scary-free" version - for families with children from 8 years old. Instead of dark and scary it gets colorful and funny at the "Black Stories Junior".

Black Stories Junior: Adventure Stories are exciting riddles for young adventurer. The players try to reconstruct the stories by asking, guessing and fiddling about.

Name: Das Fußball-Quiz
Description: This soccer quiz contains questions and answers about the world of football: data, facts, records, highlights, quotes and anecdotes. The small and compact box contains 50 cards in an updated edition.

Name: Wayfarers and Adventurers: New Characters and Options for Four Against Darkness
Description:
Wayfarers and Adventurers features additional characters for Four Against Darkness. In its pages you will find:

    The Druid, master of natural forces;
    The Green Troll, immensely strong but dim-witted;
    The Martial Mystic, able to harness the power of chi and accessing occult knowledge;
    The Gnome, combining illusion and clockwork contraptions;
    The Wood Elf, master of the forests;
    Rules for Milestones and Character Traits;
    25 new Spells;
    Two new weapons (boomerang and bolas);
    Two new animal companions (forest shadow and bearwolf);New equipment (leafsteel armor)


BONUS CONTENT: An alternative table with 6 new minions for your dungeon adventures.

—description from publisher

Name: Black Stories: Horror Movies Edition
Description: How could that have happened? Black Stories are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about. Only yes/no answers are allowed. A spooky card game just right for any party. This version of the black stories is about mysteries from the most scary horror movies.

Name: Snipers! Duck, Dodge & Shoot
Description:
Snipers! is designed to commemorate the hard fighting that took place in Italy during World War II. 
The German troops faced a determined Allied attack that came over difficult terrain in terrible conditions of cold, rain, snow, heat and dust. The advantages lay with the defender and that made the attacks costly and time consuming. Often both sides seemed to be in a quagmire that sapped morale and destroyed equipment and devoured manpower. In the end, the Allies prevailed, but their sacrifice, valor and victory were overshadowed by the D-Day landings and the campaigns in France and Germany.

This game system is fast to learn, fun to play and reflective of the realities of warfare of the Second World War. The user will not have to invest in large armies or costly terrain pieces. With a little skill and some imagination players will be able to recreate and reenact some of the most difficult kinds of combat faced by American GI's, the Canadian Armed Services and the famous British Tommies. House to house fighting against one of the most cunning and deadly enemies of the Twentieth Century; The Nazis.

—description from publisher

Name: Rally Round the Flag
Description:
Rally Round The Flag is a fast paced easy to understand game system for use in the time of The American Civil War 1861 to 1865.

Scott Monsour has captured the historical flavor of one of America's bloodiest conflicts and in doing so has created a truly unique game system for use with miniatures (both 15 mm and 25 mm scales).

This book supplies the gamer with army organizations and morale rating for regiments, brigades, divisions and corps for both Confederate and Union armies.

Command structure and leadership are an integral part of the system design. 
Movement and Combat are deftly handled in a simple yet accurate method, easy to understand and fast in play. 
The reader is supplied with two game scenarios which include orders of battle, command ratings and battle maps.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pike Hack: The Road to Dunbar
Description:
In the 17th Century, three English civil wars produced a new and truly Great Britain. In the first and second wars (1648-49), supporters of King Charles I clashed with the supporters of the Long Parliament, while the third war (1649-51) pitted supporters of King Charles II against supporters of the Rump Parliament. It all ended with the execution of King Charles I, the exile of his son, King Charles II, and the shifting of the seat of government power. The outcomes of these battles are well documented, but what would be different had the troops of King Charles II prevailed at the Battle of Worcester or if Sir John Hotham failed to keep Charles I from entering Hull? 
Pike Hack: The Road to Dunbar may have some plausible answers.

In this fun and fast-paced game, players use D-10 dice for casualty and morale calculations and D-6 dice for additional movement (evades and pursuits). The D-10 system for casualty and morale eliminates the endless modifiers that tend to make each move a monotonous chore. 
Basing figures, a common practice in many other popular game systems, is not essential to Pike Hack: The Road to Dunbar, since movement and engagements are based on numerical and figurative representations. For example, the system allows for infantry ranging from six to twelve figures and cavalry from four to ten figures; both are representations of much larger forces. 
Players are not, however, limited to small representations, as the game is designed to accommodate complete armies.

An added wrinkle in this system is the use of directional dice for command control and first artillery fire. We found that the use of directional dice for these functions keeps the game streamlined, fast-paced, realistic and fun.

The appendix contains tactical information, color illustrations to better explain tactics, and four pages of suggested army compositions. Because there are several different types of units, players are also provided with sample army lists and blank templates for composing custom lists.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Munchkin Book
Description:
More fun than a Chainsaw of Bloody Dismemberment and more useful than a Chicken on Your Head, The Munchkin Book is a lighthearted and suitably snarky celebration of all things near and dear to the munchkin heart, featuring contributions from the game's designer, Steve Jackson, and its signature artist, John Kovalic, as well as notable mavens of geek culture, including:

Joseph Scrimshaw (comedian, Comedy of Doom)
    John Wick (game designer, Houses of the Blooded)
    Bonnie Burton (author, Girls Against Girls)
    Dave Banks (Wired GeekDad)
    Matt Forbeck (author, Dangerous Games)
    Jennifer Steen (Jennisodes)
    Rob Wieland (Onion AV Club)

The Munchkin Book also includes exclusive game rules to supplement reader gameplay, and an introduction by New York Times bestselling author and Forgotten Realms creator Ed Greenwood.

—description from the publisher

By gently—and sometimes not so gently—mocking the fantasy dungeon crawl and the sacred cows of pop culture, the Munchkin® card game has stabbed and sneaked and snickered its way to the pinnacle of success. Along the way, its sold millions of copies, been translated around the world, and spawned more than two-dozen sequels and supplements.

More fun than a Chainsaw of Bloody Dismemberment and more useful than a Chicken on Your Head, The Munchkin Book is a lighthearted and suitably snarky celebration of all things near and dear to the munchkin heart, featuring contributions from the game’s designer, Steve Jackson (president of Steve Jackson Games), and its signature artist, John Kovalic (creator of web comic Dork Tower), as well as notable mavens of geek culture.

The Munchkin Book also includes exclusive game rules to supplement reader gameplay.

Steve Jackson Games, based in Austin, Texas, has been publishing games, game books, and magazines since 1980. Its best-selling game is Munchkin, with well over 2 million copies of the games and supplements in print worldwide. Other top sellers are GURPS (the Generic Universal RolePlaying System), Zombie Dice, and Illuminati. Past hits have included Car Wars and Toon. Steve’s very first game, Ogre, recently drew almost a million dollars’ worth of Kickstarter support for a super-deluxe edition to be released in 2013.

—another description from the publisher

Name: The G.A.S.L.I.G.H.T. Compendium: Quick Start Rules
Description:
Since it's initial publication in 2000, Glorious Adventures in Science Loosely Involving Generally Historical Times (G.A.S.L.I.G.H.T.) has been the standard by which all other sets of rules for Victorian Science Fiction games are judged.

The G.A.S.L.I.G.H.T. Compendium includes all the material from four books: 

     G.A.S.L.I.G.H.T., 
     Battles by G.A.S.L.I.G.H.T., 
     Adventures and Expeditions by G.A.S.L.I.G.H.T.., and 
     To Be Continued… by G.A.S.L.I.G.H.T.   


In addition The Compendium includes new rules for airship fleet battles and more detailed rules for aerial vehicles in G.A.S.L.I.G.H.T. or Battles by G.A.S.L.I.G.H.T.. 
The vehicle hit charts have been revised and combined, and there are specific vehicle hit results for walking, driving, flying, and legged vehicles. 
The record sheets used during game play have been completely revised.

With the Compendium you can play Pulp and VSF games from the large battles, through skirmishes, to role playing.  It's all here in one volume.

The GASLIGHT Quick Start Rules are a way to easily jump right into your first GASLIGHT game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Cannon Indeed!: Card Game
Description:
Based on a classical weapon dated as early as the 12th century, this is the Cannon Indeed!, an easy-to-pick-up Card Game based on Math, Luck and Logic.

Cannon Indeed! is specially designed for Single Player only. 
However, Multiplayer Mode is supported with the involvement of multiple decks (up to 4 players). There are 2 multiplayer modes – PvP and Coop.

For Single Player mode, the goal is to destroy all enemy CANNONs in play. However, you will lose if your TOWER deck has ZERO card. For each CANNON damage dealt is in the form of putting the top card of the TOWER deck into discard pile. Each CANNON will deal damage based on the total number of AMMOs sharing the same colour as the CANNON. There are 4 different colours based on CMYK Colour and Black(K)can represent any colour.

During the game, the Player will go through 3 phases. 
First is the Player's phase whereby he or she is given 3 actions to either: 
A) Draw 1 card from TOWER deck 
B) Put 1 card from hand into play 
C) Discard 2 identical cards from hand to destroy target enemy AMMO. 
Player can repeat the same action as long as 3 actions are fulfilled.

Second is the Special Event Phase whereby he or she will roll a 6-sided dice to determine one of the Special event to occur.

Third is the Enemy Phase whereby the Player will count and receive the total number of damage dealt by all the CANNONs in play

Player repeats each phase for multiple rounds until all the enemy CANNONs in play are destroyed.

—description from the designer

Name: On Tour: European Expansion
Description:
A new wrinkle on the same game.

The European map has the same rules as the USA map, but the differences in geography create a different feel and strategy.

There are fewer connections on the European map (70 lines for 39 countries vs 89 lines for 41 states). However, it is easier to get from one side of the map to the other on the Europe side. The max distance between any two countries is 6, vs a max distance of 10 on the USA map. So on Europe, it is easier to zigzag around the whole board, but harder to wiggle around in close quarters.

Includes just the 8 double sided boards and Europe cards (no dice, markers, USA cards, or box).

The second edition of the base game already contains the Europe expansion.

Name: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Zeo Ranger Pack
Description:
The Mighty Morphin Power Rangers discover the Zeo Crystal and gain access to brand new powers and zords!

The Zeo Ranger Pack adds 5 new playable heroes, along with their unique Zords and powerful Zeo Megazord to Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid. The five core members of the Zeo Rangers: Tommy Oliver, Adam Park, Rocky DeSantos, Tanya Sloan, and Kat Hillard leap into battle using new and unique Zeo Ranger abilities.

Requires Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid to play.
Families: Game: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid
Series: Power Rangers Heroes of the Grid Phase 2

Name: Collexion
Description:
Collect polygons to create sets which will win you points. Seems easy? Well, watch out! All the pieces you collect that aren’t part of a set will lose you points at the end of the game! Don’t be too greedy and make sure to keep an eye on your opponents’ pieces!

—description from the publisher

Name: Maracas
Description:
To become the best Maracas player in the world, you need a good ear and a touch of malice. Correctly estimate the number of gems inside the maracas to surpass your opponents.

—description from the publisher

Name: Spring in eine Pfütze!: Das Brettspiel
Description:
In 2020, Viktoria and Sarina are the hosts of a YouTube channel with more than 1.6 million followers, and they're the authors of the book series "Spring in eine PfuÌˆtze!" ("Jump in a Puddle!")

Spring in eine PfuÌˆtze! – Das Brettspiel gives readers a chance to jump in the world of these books, competing in four different task categories — "Gift", "Friend Battle", "Imagine", and "Friend Assessment" — to see who knows their friends well and will use that knowledge to increase their odds of winning.

Name: Midnight Exchange
Description:
Steal the best booty to trade it for the most beautiful works of art, and complete your collections in order to win the most points at the end of Midnight Exchange.

—description from the publisher

Name: Blast Tactics
Description:
A battle to the finish! Blast Tactics is a tabletop take on your favorite strategic bomber battle royale video game series!

Blast Tactics is a rebrand with new mechanisms of former officially licensed Super Bomberman R: Blast Tactics that was cancelled upon IDW Games closure.

A turn-based tactical take on your favorite video game series!

A simple to play ruleset that allows for millions of ways a game can play out. A shrinking arena allows for an exciting finale with a finite end! A custom arena with extra variant components and arena pieces allow for a large amount of replayability.

—description from the designer

Name: Commit the Garde!: Waterloo
Description:
Commit the Garde! - Waterloo

The first add-on scenario for Commit the Garde!

The classic final battle of the Napoleonic wars.

—description from the publisher

Name: Above the Clouds!: Missile Age
Description:
Missile Age is an expansion product for Above the Clouds! (which is required for use).  
Missile Age takes air combat beyond the age of gunfighters which fought in the skies over Korea, incorporating early missile armed air combat.

In addition to expanding the rules to cover missile combat between aircraft (including RADAR, rudimentary ECM, etc.), Missile Age also adds ground-to-air combat including mass FlaK battery barrages, individual anti-aircraft artillery (AAA) sites, Surface to Air Missiles (SAMs), and Man-Portable Air Defense missiles (ManPADs).

While we were at it, we decided to incorporate some optional rules for Above the Clouds, some based upon suggestions from veteran players.  These include an alternate maneuver order, limitations for tailing friendly aircraft, and non-simultaneous gun combat resolution.

Missile Age includes the first scenario package, Route Pack 6, which covers the air combat which occurred in South-East Asia from the mid 1960s and 1970s.

Route Pack 6 contains aircraft performance displays (APDs) for 28 aircraft, 4 models of Air-to-Air Missile (including 20 versions of those missiles), and one SAM system, the SA-2 (in 4 versions)

—description from the publisher

Name: Above the Clouds!: Shark Mouths and Blood Chits
Description:
Shark Mouths and Blood Chits is an expansion for the Above the Clouds!  air-combat miniature wargame rules.

It covers the early period of World War II in China, during the American Volunteer Group’s (AVG) fight with the Japanese Army’s air units from December 1941-July 1942.

Shark Mouths and Blood Chits includes:

     18 historical encounters, 
     2 hypothetical encounters, and 
     19 all new Aircraft Performance Displays (APDs)


—description from the publisher

Name: Above the Clouds!: Across the Yalu
Description:
Across the Yalu is the most ambitious expansion for Above the Clouds! to date.

Across the Yalu expands the game beyond World War II into the dawn of the jet age, featuring the air battles of the Korean War.

Across the Yalu includes twenty-nine APDs including twenty-four completely new aircraft.

—description from the publisher

Name: Above the Clouds!: Blitz!
Description:
Blitz! is an Aircraft Pack expansion for the Above the Clouds!  air-combat miniature wargame rules.

Blitz! provides the aircraft performance displays (APDs) required for the epic aerial battles over France and the Battle of Britain.

Blitz! includes the following 24 new APDs.

—description from the publisher
